009package imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.circle.algebraic;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
012
013import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
014
015import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
016import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.PntUtils;
017import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
018
019/**
020 * This is an implementation of the modified Kåsa [1] circle fitting algorithm described in 
021 * [2, Sec. 5.1]. A description of the concrete algorithm can be found in [3, Alg. 11.1].
022 * See {@link CircleFitKasaA} for the original version.
023 * <p>
024 * Compared to the original Kåsa algorithm, this variant also solves a 3x3 linear
025 * system but uses a slightly different setup of the scatter matrix (using only
026 * powers of 2 instead of 3). A numerical solver is used for this purpose.
027 * The algorithm is fast but shares the same numerical instabilities and bias when 
028 * sample points are taken from a small circle segment.
029 * It fails when matrix M becomes singular.
030 * Fits to exactly 3 (non-collinear) points are handled properly.
031 * Data centering is used to improve numerical stability (alternatively, a reference
032 * point can be specified).
033 * </p>
034 * <p>
035 * [1] I. Kåsa. "A circle fitting procedure and its error analysis",
036 * <em>IEEE Transactions on Instrumentation and Measurement</em> <strong>25</strong>(1), 
037 * 8–14 (1976).
038 * <br>
039 * [2] N. Chernov. "Circular and Linear Regression: Fitting Circles and
040 * Lines by Least Squares". Monographs on Statistics and Applied Probability.
041 * Taylor &amp; Francis (2011).
042 * <br>
043 * [3] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing - An Algorithmic Approach</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
044 * </p>
045 * 
046 * @author WB
047 * @see CircleFitKasaA
048 * @see CircleFitKasaC
049 *
050 */
051public class CircleFitKasaB implements CircleFitAlgebraic {
052
053        private final double[] q;       // q = (B,C,D) circle parameters, A=1
054        
055        /**
056         * Constructor.
057         * The centroid of the sample points is used as the reference point.
058         * 
059         * @param points sample points
060         */
061        public CircleFitKasaB(Pnt2d[] points) {
062                this(points, null);
063        }
064
065        /**
066         * Constructor.
067         * The centroid of the sample points is used as the reference point for data
068         * centering if {@code null} is passed for {@code xref}.
069         * 
070         * @param points sample points
071         * @param xref reference point or {@code null}
072         */
073        public CircleFitKasaB(Pnt2d[] points, Pnt2d xref) {
074                this.q = fit(points, xref);
075        }
076        
077        
078        @Override
079        public double[] getParameters() {
080                return q;
081        }
082        
083        private double[] fit(Pnt2d[] pts, Pnt2d xref) {
084                final int n = pts.length;
085                if (n < 3) {
086                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("at least 3 points are required");
087                }
088                
089                if (xref == null) {
090                        xref = PntUtils.centroid(pts);
091                }
092                final double xr = xref.getX();
093                final double yr = xref.getY();
094
095                // calculate elements of scatter matrix
096                double sx = 0, sy = 0, sz = 0;
097                double sxy = 0, sxx = 0, syy = 0, sxz = 0, syz = 0;
098                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
099                        final double x = pts[i].getX() - xr;
100                        final double y = pts[i].getY() - yr;
101                        final double x2 = sqr(x);
102                        final double y2 = sqr(y);
103                        final double z = x2 + y2;
104                        sx  += x;
105                        sy  += y;
106                        sz  += z;
107                        sxx += x2;
108                        syy += y2;
109                        sxy += x * y;   
110                        sxz += x * z;
111                        syz += y * z;
112                }
113                
114                double[][] X = {                                // scatter matrix X
115                                {sxx, sxy, sx},
116                                {sxy, syy, sy},
117                                { sx,  sy,  n}};
118            
119                double[] b = {-sxz, -syz, -sz};  // RHS vector
120                double[] qq = Matrix.solve(X, b); // solve M * qq = b (exact), for parameter vector qq = (B, C, D)
121                if (qq == null) {
122                        return null;    // M is singular, no solution
123                }
124                else {
125                        // re-adjust for data centering
126                        RealMatrix M = CircleFitAlgebraic.getDecenteringMatrix(xr, yr);
127                        return M.operate(new double[] {1, qq[0], qq[1], qq[2]});        // q = (A,B,C,D)
128                }
129        }
130
131}
